emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Code Review
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that automatically review code for bugs, security vulnerabilities, and compliance with coding standards, integrating real-time suggestions and corrections.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error in software, enhances security, and accelerates development cycles, potentially leading to job displacement in code review roles.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on the trust in AI's capability to identify and resolve complex issues, regulatory acceptance, and integration into existing development workflows.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Enhanced Cognitive Tools
emerging_technologies.description: Devices that integrate with human cognitive functions to enhance learning, memory, and decision-making capabilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to cognitive enhancements, raising ethical questions about equality, privacy, and the potential for cognitive divide.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on ethical considerations, public perception of safety, and the development of non-invasive, user-friendly interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Smart City Infrastructure
emerging_technologies.description: Integrated systems for managing city services like traffic, energy, waste, and emergency services, optimizing for efficiency and sustainability.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances urban living standards but requires substantial investment and could lead to privacy concerns regarding data collection.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant investment, political will, and public acceptance of data collection for urban management.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Coding Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced AI tools that not only complete code but also suggest improvements, debug in real-time, and help with documentation.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in software development teams, becoming a standard tool in IDEs.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: Blockchain technology used for secure, verifiable digital identities, enhancing privacy and security in online transactions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into major digital services, with regulatory frameworks evolving to support its use.

epoch_themes.description: Enhancing human cognitive abilities through technology, focusing on learning, memory, and decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Creates a divide between enhanced and non-enhanced individuals, prompting discussions on fairness and access.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing demand for personal enhancement tools, with companies and educational institutions exploring applications.

epoch_themes.description: Leveraging technology for making cities more sustainable, efficient, and livable.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improves quality of life, reduces environmental impact, but requires a balance with privacy and personal freedoms.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards smart cities as urban populations grow, with international collaboration on best practices.

epoch_themes.description: The pervasive use of AI in daily activities, from coding to urban management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transforms how services are delivered, potentially affecting employment and necessitating new skills.
epoch_themes.global_trends: AI becoming a fundamental part of infrastructure, education, and personal life, with a focus on ethical AI development.
